sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: Rivendell Macro Language (or RML for short) is a set of commands implemented within Rivendell that can be used to program the system to take various actions. A wide variety of commands exist, ranging from control of outboard gear (such as switchers and GPIO devices) to control of various aspects of log playout in RDAirPlay, to Rivendell user management.

sect1.title: Protocol
sect1.para: The Normal form of a command takes the following syntax:

listitem.para: A command mneumonic consisting of two alpha-numeric characters indicating the action to be performed.
Zero or more arguments, delimited by spaces or, if the last argument, by ! (see below)
The ASCII character 33, indicating the end of the command sequence.

sect1.title: Command Delivery
sect1.para: To be executed by a Rivendell system, an appropriate command should be delivered to UDP ports 5858 or 5859 on said system, using the SOCK_DGRAM connectionless protocol. Commands delivered to port 5858 may receive a reply back to the originating IP address at UDP socket 5860 to indicated command success/failure, while commanders delivered to 5859 will be processed, but no reply made.

sect1.title: Command Reply
sect1.para: If delivered to UDP port 5858, each command may receive a reply, formulated as follows:

listitem.para: The full command string (including arguments) originally received
ACK response, indicates success of the command.
NAK response, indicates failure of the command.

sect1.title: Log Machines
sect1.para: Some commands (e.g., MD, PL, and PS) require a log machine argument. See Log Machines in RDAirPlay for a detailed description of Log Machines.

The log machine argument in the context of Rivendell macros must be an integer ranging from Zero (0) to Three (3). 0 represents all log machines, 1 represents the Main Log, 2 represents Aux Log 1, and 3 represents Aux Log 2.
For example, the macro PL 1 0! starts playing at the first line (0) of the Main Log (log machine 1).

sect2.title: Air Gate [AG]
sect2.para: Process an RML only if the On-Air flag is ON.
AG rml!
Execute RML rml only if the On-Air flag on the local machine is ON.

sect2.title: Append Log [AL]
sect2.para: Append a log to a cuurently loaded log.
Append the log named logname to the log currently loaded in log machine mach.

sect2.title: Binary Serial Out [BO]
sect2.para: Output a string of binary codes.
Output a string of binary codes represented by hexcode .. on serial port portnum!

sect2.title: Clear Serial Trap [SC]
sect2.para: Clear a serial trap.

Clear a serial trap. The three argument form will clear all traps on port that reference cart and string. The two argument form will clear all traps on port that reference cart, while the one argument form will clear all traps on port.

sect2.title: Command Send [CC]
sect2.para: Send RML to a remote host.
Send the RML command rml to dest.dest may be either a Rivendell host name or an IP address. A UDP port value may be optionally specified as udpport (default value 5859).

sect2.title: Connect Jack Ports [JC]
sect2.para: Connect a JACK input port to an output port.
Attempt to connect JACK input port input to output.

sect2.title: Console Label [CL]
sect2.para: Set the label on a control surface.
On matrix matrix, set the input chan module label of control surface surface to label.

sect2.title: Copy Cut [CP]
sect2.para: Copy cut audio and metadata.
Copy the audio and metadata from cut number srccut in cart srccart to cut number dstcut in cart dstcart. The destination cart/cut must already exist.

sect2.title: Cut Event [CE]
sect2.para: Place a cut event at the current location of an active RDCatch recording.
Place a cut event with event number eventnum at the current position of the active recording in RDCatch Deck decknum.

sect2.title: Disconnect Jack Ports [JD]
sect2.para: Disconnect a JACK input port from an output port.
Attempt to disconnect JACK input port input from output.

sect2.title: Disconnect All Jack Ports [JZ]
sect2.para: Disconnect all JACK input port connections.
Attempt to disconnect all JACK port connections.

sect2.title: Duck Panel Button [PD]
sect2.para: Set the duck level of a SoundPanel button in RDAirPlay.

para.userinput: PD panel col row level fade [mport]!

sect2.para: Set the duck level of button at column, row> of panel panel. Panel: S1...S50 or U1...U50; C for panel means currently selected panel. If col and/or row is 0: duck all buttons in col or row. If playing, the audio fades to level (in dbFS) in fade msecs. If specified, only stop carts playing on panel port mport. The duck level will be set to 0 after the playback is finished, or the button is stopped or reset.

sect2.title: Execute Breakaway [DX]
sect2.para: Execute a breakaway.

Execute a breakaway of length len (in mS) using the autofill carts configured for the service currently loaded in the slot slot. The slot must be in Breakaway mode. If a breakaway is currently executing, it will immediately be aborted and a new one started. Passing a '0' for len will cause any currently executing breakaway immediately to be aborted and input audio restored.

sect2.title: Execute Cart [EX]
sect2.para: Execute a macro cart.
Execute macro cart cartnum on the local host.

sect2.title: Fire Salvo [FS]
sect2.para: Execute a switcher salvo.
Fire salvo number salvo on matrix matrix.

sect2.title: GPI Enable [GE]
sect2.para: Enable/disable a GPI line.
Enable or disable the GPI line of type type indicated by gpinum on matrix matrix. Possible types are:

sect2.title: GPI Enable [GE] (old format, deprecated)
sect2.para: Enable/disable a GPI line.
Enable or disable the GPI line indicated by gpinum on matrix matrix.

sect2.title: GPI Set [GI]
sect2.para: Set action in response to a GPIO event.

para.userinput: GI matrix type gpinum state cart!

sect2.para: Execute the macro cart cart upon transition of the GPIO of type type and line gpinum on matrix matrix to state. Possible types are:

sect2.title: GPI Set [GI] (old format, deprecated)
sect2.para: Set action in response to a GPIO event.
Execute the macro cart cart upon transition of the GPIO of line gpinum on matrix matrix to state.

sect2.title: GPO Set [GO]
sect2.para: Set the state of a GPIO line.

para.userinput: GO matrix type gponum state length!

sect2.para: Command GPIO line gponum of type type on matrix matrix> to state for length> mS. A length of 0 indicates to hold the state indefinitely. Possible types are:
Possible states are:

varlistentry.listitem: Passthrough hardware input (valid only for Input type)

sect2.title: GPO Set [GO] (old format, deprecated)
sect2.para: Set the state of a GPIO line.
Command GPIO line gponum on matrix matrix> to state for length> mS. A length of 0 indicates to hold the state indefinitely.

sect2.title: Insert Cart [PX]
sect2.para: Insert a cart in a log.
Insert cart cart after the currently playing or next event plus offset (default '0') lines on log machine mach. The transition may also be optionally specified.

sect2.title: Insert Serial Trap [SI]
sect2.para: Insert a serial trap to detect a character sequence.
Insert a serial trap to execute the macro cart cart upon receipt of string on serial port port.

sect2.title: Label Panel [PC]
sect2.para: Set the label of a SoundPanel button in RDAirPlay.

para.userinput: PC panel col row label color!

sect2.para: Set the button at col, row of panel panel to have a text label of label and a background color of color. Panel: S1...S50 or U1...U50; C for panel means currently selected panel.

sect2.title: Load Log [LL]
sect2.para: Load a log into RDAirPlay.

Load the log logname in log machine mach. After loading, start the log at line startline if it is >=0. If startline is -2, the log will be started at the first event if that event does not have a 'stop' transition. Default startline=-1. If no log> is specified, the machine's current log is unloaded.

sect2.title: Load Panel [PE]
sect2.para: Load a cart into a SoundPanel button in RDAirPlay.
Load cart cart into the button at col,row of panel panel. Panel: S1...S50 or U1...U50; C for panel means currently selected panel.

sect2.title: Load Slot [DL]
sect2.para: Load an RDCartSlots slot.
This command has two syntaxes, depending upon the mode of the slot.
Cart Deck Mode syntax:
Load the cart cart into the slot slot. Passing a '0' for cart will cause the slot to be unloaded. This command will be ignored if the slot is currently playing.
Breakaway Mode syntax:
Set the slot slot to use service svcname. Omitting the svcname argument will cause the slot to be unloaded. This command will be ignored if the slot is currently executing a breakaway.

sect2.title: Login [LO]
sect2.para: Change the active Rivendell user context.
Set the current Rivendell user to user. If no arguments are supplied, log out the station --i.e. revert to the default user.

sect2.title: Macro Timer [MT]
sect2.para: Timer for running macro carts.
Set the macro timer timernum to execute macro cart cart in timeout milliseconds. Setting timeout to 0 disables the timer. Sixteen macro timers (numbered 1-16) are available on each Rivendell host.

sect2.title: Make Next [MN]
sect2.para: Load changes to a currently loaded log in RDAirPlay.
Set the next event for log machine mach to line line>.

sect2.title: Message Box [MB]
sect2.para: Display a popup message box on a host display.
Display the text msg in a popup window on X display display, with an icon to indicate severity. Valid values of severity are:

When using the 'Message Box' ['MB'] RML, it may be necessary to configure the X server to allow local connections from other processes. One way to do this is to execute the following command as the local Rivendell user:
For more information, see the xhost1 man page.

sect2.title: No Operation [NN]
sect2.para: Do nothing.
This RML does precisely nothing.

sect2.title: Pause Panel [PU]
sect2.para: Pause a SoundPanel button in RDAirPlay.

Pause the button at col, row of panel panel. Panel: S1...S50 or U1...U50; C for panel means currently selected panel. If col and/or row is 0: pause all playing buttons in col or row. If specified, start the playout on panel port mport.

sect2.title: Play Panel [PP]
sect2.para: Load a cart into a SoundPanel button in RDAirPlay.

Play the button at col, row of panel panel. Panel: S1...S50 or U1...U50; C for panel means currently selected panel. If col and/or row is 0: Start the first loaded button that is not active. If specified, start the playout on panel port mport. The started panel will stay active when finished, if the 5th argument is 1.

sect2.title: Play Slot [DP]
sect2.para: Play an RDCartSlots slot.
Play the cart currently loaded in the slot slot. The slot must be in Cart Deck mode. This command will be ignored if the slot is unloaded or already playing.

sect2.title: Refresh Log [RL]
sect2.para: Load changes to a currently loaded log in RDAirPlay.
Refresh the log currently loaded in log machine mach.

sect2.title: Run Shell Command [RN]
sect2.para: Run a shell command.
Run the shell command cmd.

note.para: The command is actually executed as:
using the user and group specified by the "RnRmlOwner=" and "RnRmlGroup=" directives in the "[Identity]" section of rd.conf5.

sect2.title: Select Widget [PW]
sect2.para: Select right-hand widget in RDAirPlay.
Select right-hand widget to log-machine mach or 0 for sound panel.

sect2.title: Serial Out [SO]
sect2.para: Output a string on a serial port.
Output data on serial port portnum. data can consist of arbitrary binary data as well as textual characters (see Binary Data above).

sect2.title: Serial Reload [SY]
sect2.para: Reload the configuration for a serial port.
Reload the configuration for serial port portnum. Normally, this should only be issued by RDAdmin following a configuration change.

sect2.title: Set Color Label [LC]
sect2.para: Display a color message in the label widget on RDAirPlay.
Display string> in color color in the message widget.

sect2.title: Set Default Now & Next Cart [SN]
sect2.para: Set the default Now & Next cart.
SN now|next mach cart!
Set the default Now & Next cart for log mach to cart.

sect2.title: Set Display [SD]
sect2.para: Set a console display.

para.userinput: SD matrix display line col attr label!

sect2.para: On matrix matrix, set the console display display to label, starting at position line, col and using message attributes attr.
The message attributes value is constructed as follows:
Display Mode:
Video Attribute:
Text Color:

sect2.title: Set Duck Level [MD]
sect2.para: Set duck level for an RDAirPlay log machine.

Set the duck level of mach, or 0 for all log machines. If playing, the audio fades to level (in dbFS) in fade msecs. If specified, only affect carts playing on machine port mport. Loading or clearing a log will set the duck level back to 0.

sect2.title: Set Label [LB]
sect2.para: Display a message in the label widget on RDAirPlay.
Display string> in the message widget.

sect2.title: Set Mode [PM]
sect2.para: Set the mode of an RDAirPlay log machine.

Set log machine mach to mode mode. If mode is not given or the Mode Control Style is set to 'Unified', then all log machines are set to mode. Valid values for mode are:
1 LiveAssist
2 Auto
3 Manual

sect2.title: Sleep [SP]
sect2.para: Pause for specified time.
Wait for msecs milliseconds.

sect2.title: Start [PL]
sect2.para: Start a log at a specified line.
Start log machine mach at line line if stopped, otherwise do nothing.

sect2.title: Start Button [PB]
sect2.para: Push an RDAirPlay Start button (1-7, numbered from the top).
Push button button.

sect2.title: Start Next [PN]
sect2.para: Start the next event in a log.

Start log machine mach> if stopped, or start next event if already running. If specified, start the playout on machine port mport>. If skip is supplied, equal to '1' and the log machine is in Manual or Live Assist mode, then any intervening meta-events in log between the current 'next' event and the next cart will be skipped over.

sect2.title: Start Record Deck [RS]
sect2.para: Start an RDCatch Recording

Start recording to cut cutnum of cart cartnum, using RDCatch record deck decknum for a maximum time of maxlen mS. The record parameters used (format, sample rate, channels, etc) will be those configured for the selected deck in RDAdmin->ManageHosts->RDCatch. The selected cart and cut must already exist. Any audio previously residing in the selected cart and cut will be overwritten.

sect2.title: Stop [PS]
sect2.para: Stop a log in RDAirPlay.
Stop log machine mach, or 0 for all log machines. If specified, only stop carts playing on machine port mport. If specified, fade out fade msecs.

sect2.title: Stop Panel [PT]
sect2.para: Stop a SoundPanel button in RDAirPlay.

Stop the button at col, row of panel panel. Panel: S1...S50 or U1...U50; C for panel means currently selected panel. If col and/or row is 0: stop all playing buttons in col or row. If specified, start the playout on panel port mport. The stopped panel will stay active when finished, if the 5th argument is 1.

sect2.title: Stop Record Deck [RR]
sect2.para: Stop an RDCatch Recording
Stop any active recording on RDCatch deck decknum.

sect2.title: Stop Slot [DS]
sect2.para: Stop an RDCartSlots slot.
Stop the cart currently loaded in the slot slot. The slot must be in Cart Deck mode. This command will be ignored if the slot is unloaded or already playing.

sect2.title: Switch Add [SA]
sect2.para: Add an input to an output.
Command switch matrix number matrix to add input number input to output number output. Unlike SWITCH TAKE, this command leaves any other previously assigned inputs unchanged.

sect2.title: Switch Add With Gain [SG]
sect2.para: Add an input to an output while specifyng the crosspoint gain.

Command switch matrix number matrix to add input number input to output number output at gain gain. The gain is specified in 1/10 of a dB, with 0 = unity gain. Unlike SWITCH TAKE, this command leaves any other previously assigned inputs unchanged.

sect2.title: Switch Crosspoint Gain [SX]
sect2.para: Set crosspoint gain.
Command switch matrix number matrix to adjust the gain of the crosspoint connecting input input to output output to level dB.

sect2.title: Switch Level [SL]
sect2.para: Set input gain.
Command switch matrix number matrix to adjust the gain of input number input to level dB.

sect2.title: Switch Reload [SZ]
sect2.para: Reload the configuration for a switch matrix.
Reload the configuration for switch matrix matrix. Normally, this should only be issued by RDAdmin following a configuration change.

sect2.title: Switch Remove [SR]
sect2.para: Remove an input from an output.
Command switch matrix number matrix to remove input number input from output number output. Unlike SWITCH TAKE, this command leaves any other previously assigned inputs unchanged.

sect2.title: Switch Take [ST]
sect2.para: Exclusively route an input to an output.
Command switch matrix number matrix to take input number input to output number output. "Take" in this context implies removing any previously assigned inputs from the referenced output.

sect2.title: Toggle On Air Flag [TA]
sect2.para: Set the state of the On Air flag.
Set the On-Air flag to ON [1] or OFF [0].

sect2.title: UDP Out [UO]
sect2.para: Send data to a UDP port.
Send data in a UDP packet to port udpport at ipaddr. data can consist of arbitrary binary data as well as textual characters (see Binary Data above).
